page.title: 10BEVERTON FARM
page.content: We visited the old man who lived at Beverton Farm, this farm is typical of the traditional farms in the area. It used to be a sixty acre farm with cattle and sheep but he has now sold off most of the land and is left with five acres around his house. The farmhouse had once been lived in by the engine driver from the iron ore railway and subsequently by the present owners parents. He has lived there all his life, 74 years. He has never married and now lives on his own. The farmhouse used to be one down two up but his parents extended it on both sides and it now has four bedrooms. The walls are of stone and both the roof and some of the walls are covered with slates. He has had visits from various firms trying to persuade him to spend money on it but he has not done so.
